title: Twitter junior
text: When Threads first came out, I gave it a try and within a week, I dumped it. It very quickly proved to be as ugly and unmoderated as Twitter. I've seen gay bashing, blatant racism, and all manner of other ugly, disrespectful posts in Threads that, in a couple of cases, went viral enough to start showing up in my regular Instagram feed every time I opened it, going so far as to start suggesting I follow these people. Instagram, in general, was a much more fun and welcoming platform before it was bought out by Facebook. Threads is just a layer of hot, steaming Meta garbage, in a sad, desperate attempt to be the next Twitter, on a platform that never needed it.

title: Need to have iPad formatted display screen
text: Really enjoyed the thread Service, but the app is a real pain to use on an iPad which I mainly use for my social media APPS. can’t understand why developers can’t have an app that is properly formatted to use the iPad screen just like the Facebook app. I would use it more if the app was better suited for use on an iPad really cumbersome to use as in screen size text and keyboard too small on an iPad.

title: Meta is evil
text:
All meta apps actively have taken part in societal degrading activities, they have gone too far too many times.

Personally I have received death threats online that dont get taken down, but I get ban threats from meta for calling someone dumb. 

They instigate arguments for retention.

 They allow massive amounts of bots to instigate, spam, scam, and pump up numbers to seem bigger than they are and misrepresent positions. 

Really disgusting behavior. I will slowly begin leaving and moving out of anything META related.

title: Where did my Following timeline go?
